intro: Gomesa foliosa, commonly known as the featherleaf gomesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. Gomesa foliosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and modest floral display.
